questions.question: What is the average alcohol content in the dataset?
questions.hint: Use df['alcohol'].mean() to compute the mean.

questions.question: Is there a statistically significant difference in mean quality between wines with alcohol > 10% and alcohol ≤ 10%?
questions.hint: Split the data by alcohol threshold, then perform a two-sample t-test (scipy.stats.ttest_ind).

questions.question: What is the Pearson correlation coefficient between volatile acidity and quality?
questions.hint: Use scipy.stats.pearsonr on the two columns.

questions.question: Build a simple linear regression model to predict quality using alcohol as the sole predictor. What is the R-squared of this model?
questions.hint: Fit OLS with statsmodels: sm.OLS(df['quality'], sm.add_constant(df['alcohol'])).fit(); retrieve rsquared.

questions.question: Which feature has the strongest absolute correlation with quality?
questions.hint: Compute df.corr()['quality'].abs() and identify the max (excluding quality itself).

questions.question: Create a binary label: high_quality (quality ≥ 7) vs low_quality (quality < 7). What is the accuracy of a logistic regression model using all numeric features to predict this label? Use train_test_split with random_state=42.
questions.hint: Create the label, split data, fit LogisticRegression (solver='lbfgs', max_iter=1000), evaluate accuracy on test set.

questions.question: Perform a chi-square test to examine whether the distribution of high_quality vs low_quality differs across three equal-sized bins of fixed acidity.
questions.hint: Bin fixed acidity into three categories with pd.qcut, create contingency table with pd.crosstab, then run scipy.stats.chi2_contingency.

questions.question: What is the mean residual sugar for each quality level (3 through 8)?
questions.hint: Group by 'quality' and compute the mean of 'residual sugar'.

questions.question: Does adding sulphates to a multiple linear regression model (with alcohol and volatile acidity) improve the adjusted R-squared for predicting quality?
questions.hint: Fit two OLS models: one with alcohol & volatile acidity, another adding sulphates; compare adjusted R-squared values.

questions.question: Using a 5-fold cross‑validation (random_state=42), what is the average mean absolute error (MAE) of a Ridge regression model predicting quality from all features?
questions.hint: Instantiate Ridge(alpha=1.0), use cross_val_score with scoring='neg_mean_absolute_error' and cv=5, then take the mean of absolute values.

questions.question: Identify the top three features that, when used individually in simple linear regressions, yield the highest R-squared values for predicting quality.
questions.hint: Loop over each feature, fit OLS with that single predictor, store rsquared, then sort and select top three.

questions.question: Is the distribution of pH significantly different between wines with total sulfur dioxide > 150 and ≤ 150? Use a Mann‑Whitney U test.
questions.hint: Split by the threshold, then run scipy.stats.mannwhitneyu.

questions.question: What proportion of wines have quality ≥ 7?
questions.hint: Calculate (df['quality'] >= 7).mean().

questions.question: Create a scatter plot matrix (pairplot) for the features: alcohol, sulphates, and quality. Which pair shows the most visible linear trend?
questions.hint: Use seaborn.pairplot with vars=['alcohol','sulphates','quality']; visually inspect.

questions.question: Perform a stepwise forward selection (using p‑values) to build a regression model for quality. Which variables are selected?
questions.hint: Iteratively add the variable with the lowest p‑value (<0.05) using OLS until no further improvement.

questions.question: Using Principal Component Analysis (PCA) with random_state=42, how many components are required to explain at least 90% of the variance?
questions.hint: Standardize features, fit PCA, compute cumulative explained variance, find minimal number of components reaching 0.90.

questions.question: Train a Support Vector Regressor (SVR) with RBF kernel to predict quality from all features. Using train_test_split(random_state=42), what is the test R²?
questions.hint: Standardize data, split, fit SVR (C=1.0, epsilon=0.1), predict on test set, compute r2_score.

questions.question: Does removing outliers (values beyond 3 standard deviations for any feature) improve the performance of a Linear Regression model predicting quality? Compare R² before and after removal.
questions.hint: Identify outliers using np.abs(zscore) > 3, drop them, fit OLS on original and cleaned data, compare rsquared.

questions.question: Construct a decision tree regressor (max_depth=4) to predict quality. Using cross‑validation (random_state=42), what is the average RMSE?
questions.hint: Use sklearn.tree.DecisionTreeRegressor, set max_depth=4, cross_val_score with scoring='neg_root_mean_squared_error', take mean of absolute values.

questions.question: Is there a monotonic relationship between density and quality? Compute the Spearman rank correlation.
questions.hint: Use scipy.stats.spearmanr on density and quality.

questions.question: Create a new feature ‘acid_index’ = fixed acidity / volatile acidity. Does this feature alone achieve a higher R² than fixed acidity alone when predicting quality?
questions.hint: Compute acid_index, fit two separate OLS models (one with fixed acidity, one with acid_index), compare rsquared.

questions.question: Using bootstrapping (1000 resamples, random_state=42), estimate the 95% confidence interval for the mean alcohol content.
questions.hint: Resample the 'alcohol' column with replacement 1000 times, compute means, then take the 2.5th and 97.5th percentiles.

questions.question: Perform a two‑way ANOVA to assess the effect of 'chlorides' (low/high split at median) and 'pH' (low/high split at median) on quality.
questions.hint: Create two binary factors via median splits, then use statsmodels.formula.api.ols with interaction term and statsmodels.stats.anova_lm.

questions.question: Apply a Box‑Cox transformation to the 'residual sugar' variable (ensure positivity). After transformation, does a linear model using transformed residual sugar improve R² compared to the raw variable?
questions.hint: Use scipy.stats.boxcox, fit OLS models with raw and transformed residual sugar, compare rsquared.

questions.question: Using a permutation test (10,000 permutations, random_state=42), assess whether the observed correlation between alcohol and quality is greater than expected by chance.
questions.hint: Shuffle quality labels, compute correlation each permutation, calculate p‑value as proportion of permuted correlations ≥ observed.

questions.question: Fit a Bayesian linear regression (using statsmodels BayesianRegression) to predict quality from all features. What is the posterior mean estimate for the coefficient of sulphates?
questions.hint: Instantiate sm.BayesianRegression, fit, then extract the posterior mean for 'sulphates'.

questions.question: Construct a stacking ensemble that combines Ridge, Lasso, and ElasticNet regressors (random_state=42) to predict quality. Using 5‑fold cross‑validation, what is the ensemble’s average R²?
questions.hint: Create base estimators, use sklearn.ensemble.StackingRegressor, cross_val_score with scoring='r2', average the scores.
